alert.note: Alert for Lower Garfield and Asotin Counties; Washington Palouse (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 10 at 11:28PM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Garfield and southern Whitman Counties through 1215 AM PDT... At 1127 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Turner, or 14 miles northeast of Dayton, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Pomeroy. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Lower Garfield and Asotin Counties; Washington Palouse
